adjectives.description: wizen (comparative more wizen, superlative most wizen)

entries.meaning: Wizened; withered; lean and wrinkled by shrinkage as from age or illness.
examples: His face was wizen and wrinkled, his faded blue eyes dim and weak-looking. He was feeble, and his hands were tremulous with a perpetual nervous motion.

verbs.description: wizen (third-person singular simple present wizens, present participle wizening, simple past and past participle wizened)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To wither; to become, or make, lean and wrinkled by shrinkage, as from age or illness.
